page.title: 06OLD PRIMARY SCHOOL, ELMSWELL
page.content: The school was built in 1894. It is of brick faced with stone. When the school first opened it had 15 children. Now there is a much larger population in Elmswell. There are 152 children at the school, and 2 temporary classrooms. There are 8 eight rooms altogether. There is a head teacher, 4 full time teachers, a part-time teacher, a secretary, 2 full time cooks, 1 part-time cook and a caretaker. 105 dinners are cooked every day, 28 are sent to Drinkstone and Woolpit Schools. The school has a computer, a kiln, a tape recorder and a television. There are 3 pianos. The first class keep pet gerbils. The grounds are about half an acre containing a sandpit and 3 climbing frames. A new school is being built it will be open in February 1986.
